intro: Pygeum lancilimbum, commonly known as the slender African almond, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The tree produces woody pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and horticulture.
